title: How to Make Album Art

methods.name: Creating an Album Cover with Canva

steps.headline: Create a free account on Canva's website.
steps.description: The website Canva is a place where you can quickly design and create your album art for free. To create a free account, you'll need to provide your first name and an email address. To begin, just visit the Canva website at: https://www.canva.com. You can also sign up for Canva with a Facebook or a Google account. In addition to offering a large collection of royalty-free photos and album cover layouts from which you can choose, Canva also has a free suite of online editing tools you can use to customize your album cover. Canva also has additional features you can access if you upgrade to a paid account.

steps.headline: Click the “Create a design” button after making an account.
steps.description: After you successful create an account, log in. Once you log in to your personal profile page, look for a turquoise button in the upper left-hand corner that says “Create a design.” Click on the button.

steps.headline: Find “Album Cover” in the list that pops up.
steps.description: If you don't see “Album Cover” right away, click the “More” button to the right of the different options. Then, scroll down to the “Blogging & eBooks” category. If you still can't locate the “Album Cover” link, click on “Design School” in the left-hand column. Then, select “Browse” in the main menu at the top of the page. Click on the “see all” option under the category “Design Types.”

steps.headline: Choose a layout for your album cover.
steps.description: In the top left-hand corner of the page, you'll see a button labeled “layout.” Click on it and scroll through the templates until you find 1 that you like. Once you settle on 1 you want to use, click on it. It will then appear in the main work area in the center of your screen.

steps.headline: Change the size of the album cover before continuing.
steps.description: Click on the “File” button in the upper left-hand corner of the page. Then, select “Change dimensions” and “Use custom dimensions.” Change the dimension of your image from the default 1400 x 1400 size to 3000 x 3000. You'll want to resize your album cover because iTunes and other major streaming services recommend uploading images that are 3000 x 3000 pixels for best quality.

steps.headline: Download royalty-free images to edit and use on your album.
steps.description:
To avoid any copyright conflicts, you need to make sure any photos, illustrations, or layout templates you use to create your album art are royalty-free. If you want to use any images other than those you've created, you can find royalty-free, high-quality images at the following websites:
https://www.canva.com/photos/free/
https://pxhere.com
https://burst.shopify.com
https://freephotos.cc
https://www.pexels.com
https://stocksnap.io
https://www.freeimages.com
https://unsplash.com

steps.headline: Purchase an image (or images) on a stock imagery site.
steps.description:
If you don't want to use a photo or image you created and can't find a royalty-free image you like, consider purchasing an image. Stock imagery sites collect all sorts of high-quality images from professional and amateur photographers. Just type the item, emotion, or concept you're looking for in the website's search box to see what's available. Popular stock imagery sites include:
Dreamstime (https://www.dreamstime.com)
Getty Images (https://www.gettyimages.com)
iStock (https://www.istockphoto.com)
Stocksy (https://www.stocksy.com)
Google and Pinterest aren't good places to pull images for your album art.

steps.headline: Upload any images you want to use into Canva.
steps.description: To begin the uploading process, click on the “Upload” button on the far left of the screen. Then, either drag the image file into the designated space, or click on the “Upload an image” button. You can also use the stock images that Canva provides for free if you'd like.

steps.headline: Change the text on the album cover.
steps.description: To replace the default text on the template you've selected, simply double click on the text. Then, press delete and type in the artist's name and the title of the album. Use the upper tool bar to alter the style, size, spacing, and transparency of the text. You can rearrange the position of text by clicking on it and dragging it.

steps.headline: Give your album design a title.
steps.description: Click on the text to the right of the “Share” button in the upper right-hand corner. Then, give your artwork a name so that you'll be able to distinguish it from other artwork you may design on Canva.

steps.headline: Download the image as a PNG file.
steps.description: When you're done making all your modifications to your album art, click on the “Download” button in the upper right-hand corner of the screen. Then, click on the dropdown menu under the heading “File type.” Select PNG for the highest quality image. You'll now be able to find your album art in the “Downloads” folder on your computer!

steps.headline: Download the Pixlr app on your smartphone or tablet.
steps.description: Pixlr is available on both Google Play and the Apple App Store. Download it as you would any other mobile app. There are many other mobile apps from which you can choose, which you can download either for free or for a small fee.

steps.headline: Take an image with your smartphone or a digital camera to use.
steps.description: Snap an image of an animal, a landscape, item, or person to be the base image in your artwork. You can either design your album art around an unedited or slightly edited version of your photograph or transform it into something unrecognizable using editing tools in your design program. Photographing flowers, jewelry, leaves, and other items up close can give you images with unique textures and colors. Taking a self-portrait and then editing it into an abstract image is a popular technique. Even mundane objects like cigarette butts, socks, and street traffic signs can be sources of inspiration.

steps.headline: Modify your base image with the app's editing tools.
steps.description: When you open the Pixlr app, you'll see several icons along the bottom of the screen. To edit a picture you've uploaded, click on the icon of 2 overlapping circles. Using the app's tools, you can rotate an image, adjust its color, alter its saturation, and make dozens of other modifications. Play around with these tools to modify your image so that it will better convey the mood of your music. To make an image black-and-white, click on “adjustments” and then “saturation,” and slide the bottom bar to the left. You can make an image brighter by clicking on the “exposure” icon and sliding the bar.

steps.headline: Collage several images together to create an abstract visual.
steps.description: Blending several photos together is a great way to craft an otherworldly image that captures the emotion of your music. You can create a unique image by blending as few as 2 or 3 images together. Start by choosing a base image, and then select other images that alter its appearance to reflect the emotion or concept you want to convey. This editing method will also help hide any original stock images that you're using to create your album. Use the double exposure mode to merge the layers you're putting together. Many people use stock image websites to create their album covers, so, to reflect the uniqueness of your music, you won't want to use an image as is.

steps.headline: Choose colors that reflect the mood and style of your music.
steps.description: If the music you're making album art for is melancholic, consider using cool colors like blue and purple. If your songs are light and airy, try warm colors like red, orange, and yellow. These are just suggestions, however, and you should choose whatever color scheme speaks to you. You can also use colors that contrast or clash with one another to create a striking visual. Try to stick to just 2 or 3 colors to make your art stand out.

steps.headline: Add a white frame to your album cover to make it stand out.
steps.description: Many streaming websites have dark backgrounds. Adding a white frame to your album cover is just a simple thing you can do to draw people's eyes to your music.

steps.headline: Print any text in a large and readable font.
steps.description: If you're publishing your music on online platforms, people who come across your album art will see it in thumbnail size. For this reason, if you're including the album title and artist name on the album, make sure you use a dark color for the font if the background is light, and a light font if the background is dark. You can also choose to leave text off your album cover, if you just want your listeners to just focus on the visual. Try to limit the amount of text on your album cover. Since most listeners will view it at thumbnail size, they'll probably be unable to read it anyways.

steps.headline: Crop your image so that it's a square.
steps.description: Album covers are always square. Before publishing your album art, adjust the image so that its width is equal to its length. In Adobe Photoshop CC, for example, select a 1:1 ratio.

steps.headline: Make sure your album is formatted correctly before uploading it.
steps.description: In addition to making sure your image is in a JPG or PNG format, you also need to make sure it's at least 3,000 x 3,000 pixels in size before uploading it to a streaming platform. Most major streaming platforms won't accept images that are smaller. You'll also want to make sure the resolution of the image is at least 72 DPI. Your album art should be in RGB format.
